segments.speaker: Operator
segments.text: Good afternoon, and welcome to the Apple Q1 2025 earnings conference call.

segments.speaker: Tim Cook
segments.text: Thank you, operator. We had an outstanding quarter with revenue of $124 billion, up 4% year over year.

segments.speaker: Luca Maestri
segments.text: Thanks, Tim. Let me walk through the financials. Gross margin came in at 46.9%, up 80 basis points sequentially.

segments.speaker: Operator
segments.text: We will now begin the question-and-answer session. Our first question comes from Erik Woodring with Morgan Stanley.

segments.speaker: Erik Woodring
segments.text: Congrats on the quarter. I wanted to ask about iPhone margins specifically. Given the higher component costs this cycle, how should we think about the trajectory of gross margins in the Services segment versus Hardware for the next two quarters?

segments.speaker: Luca Maestri
segments.text: Thanks, Erik. On iPhone margins, we're pleased with where we landed. Component costs did tick up but we offset that through operational efficiency. For the next couple of quarters, we expect Hardware margins to be roughly flat sequentially.

segments.speaker: Tim Cook
segments.text: And just to add, Services continues to be a strong contributor. We see that business scaling very nicely with improving margin profile.

segments.speaker: Operator
segments.text: Our next question comes from Ben Reitzes with Melius Research.

segments.speaker: Ben Reitzes
segments.text: Thanks for taking my question. I'm a bit concerned about the deceleration in Greater China revenue. Can you help us understand what's driving the weakness and whether you see the competitive environment getting tougher with Huawei's resurgence?

segments.speaker: Tim Cook
segments.text: Sure, Ben. China is a market we watch very closely. We did see some softness, partly macro-driven. On competition, we believe our ecosystem differentiation remains strong, but we're watching the situation carefully.

segments.speaker: Operator
segments.text: Our next question comes from Samik Chatterjee with JPMorgan.

segments.speaker: Samik Chatterjee
segments.text: Can you quantify the impact of FX headwinds on the guidance range? And separately, what's embedded in the March quarter guide for Services growth?

segments.speaker: Luca Maestri
segments.text: On FX, we estimate roughly 200 basis points of headwind to total revenue growth in the March quarter. For Services, we expect continued double-digit growth, consistent with the trajectory we've been on.
